results.title: Sherman's march: a meditation on the possibility of romantic love in the South during an era of nuclear weapons proliferation
results.brief_description: A journey by the filmmaker through the South follows the route of the Union’s General Sherman who carried on the war against the civilian population of the Confederacy, then largely female. Along the way McElwee is confronted by the mysteries of Southern womanhood in his encounters with eight women. His dreams are haunted by the spectre of nuclear war and he encounters signs of its pervasiveness along the way. McElwee assesses the state of his movie as he goes along, on the soundtrack and in a series of soliloquies to the camera.

results.title: She's so lovely
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Hachette Premiere, Cie, Clyde is Hungry Films, Rene Cleitman and Nick Cassavetes
results.brief_description: Sean Penn and Robin Wright Penn play husband and wife Eddie and Maureen whose devotion to each other is hindered by the self destructive behaviour which eventually leads Eddie to an institution for the criminally insane. During his ten year confinement, Maureen divorces Eddie without his knowledge, marries successful businessman Joey (John Travolta), and settles into middle class comfort to raise her three daughters. On the day of Eddie’s release, Maureen is unsettled by the emotional conflict which forces her to choose between her responsibility towards the husband she abandoned and the family that provided a refuge from her past. Based on a screenplay by John Cassavetes. Cast also includes Harry Dean Stanton, Gena Rowlands, Debi Mazar and James Gandolfini. Edited by Petra von Oelffen. Photographed by Thiery Arbogast. Music by Joseph Vitarelli.

results.title: She's having a baby
results.brief_description:
John Hughes’ romantic comedy of yuppie angst stars Kevin Bacon and Elizabeth McGovern as Jake and Kristi Briggs. Jake, after falling in love with Kristi at first sight, is beginning to have second thoughts about ending his single life as he is walking down the aisle on their wedding day. A year later their dreams of a perfect life in a perfect house have turned into a series of hilarious marital nightmares. Kristi has just received news that really ought to make things interesting - she’s pregnant.
Cast also includes: Alec Baldwin, Lili Taylor

results.title: Shanghai triad
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Film Studio, Wu Yigong, Jean-Louis Piel and Zhang Yimou
results.brief_description: Set in the 1930s, this film centres on the coming of age of Shuisheng, a country boy brought to Shanghai by his uncle to work for the powerful gang ruled by Tang. He finds himself working for Bijou, Tang’s capricious mistress and nightclub singer. When Shuisheng’s uncle and several other gang members are killed during a rival gang’s unsuccessful attempt on Tang’s life, the latter escapes to a remote island taking both Bijou and Shuisheng with him and thinking of revenge. In Mandarin with English subtitles. Cast includes: Gong Li, Li Baotian, Li Xuejian, Sun Chun and Wang Xiaoxiao.

results.title: Shanghai noon
results.creator_credit: Jackie Chan Films, Spyglass Entertainment, Touchstone Pictures, Gary Barber, Roger Birnbaum, Jonathan Glickman and Tom Dey
results.brief_description: A case of East meets West in this comic adventure Jackie Chan film set in 1850s American West. Chon Wang (Jackie Chan), an Imperial Guard, is sent across to America as part of a rescue team to find the Emperor’s kidnapped daughter, Princess Pei Pei (Lucy Liu). However it is not long before Chon Wang becomes separated from the search party and finds himself lost out in the vast open spaces of the West where he has a timely encounter with a bright but arrogant train robber by the name of Roy O’Bannon (Owen Wilson). The two become unlikely allies. Cast also includes Brandon Merrill, Roger Yuan.

results.title: Shane
results.brief_description: George Stevens’ legendary rendition of the archetypal Western myth earned six Academy Award nominations and made “Shane” one of the timeless classics of American cinema. Based on on the novel by Jack Schaefer, a drifter and retired gunfighter (Alan Ladd) comes to the assistance of a homestead family terrorized by an aging cattleman and his hired gun. In fighting the last, decisive battle, Shane sees the end of his way of life. The mysterious, moody and breathtakingly atmospheric cinematography by Loyal Griggs won an Oscar and the film is enhanced by the intense performances of its splendid cast particularly Brandon de Wilde as the young son who idolises Shane.

results.title: Shame
results.creator_credit: Barron Films, UAA Films, Paul D. Barron, Damien Parer and Steve Steve Jodrell
results.brief_description: Asta Cadell (Deborra-Lee Furness), a city barrister is touring the outback alone when she is forced to stay in a small, isolated town when her motorbike breaks down. During her enforced stay she uncovers the scandal that grips the town in fear, and becomes the catalyst for a dramatic and riveting battle. A disturbing look at the sexual attitudes of an Australian rural society in decline. Also stars Simone Buchanan and Tony Barry.

results.title: Shallow grave
results.creator_credit: Figment Films, Glascow Film Office, Channel 4, Andrew Macdonald and Danny Boyle
results.brief_description: What would you do if your new roommate mysteriously dies, leaving an open suitcase full of money? This is the situation that faces three young professionals (Kerry Fox, Christopher Eccleston and Ewan McGregor) when they take in a new border after stringently screening for a successful applicant. It seems an easy choice to make but when they decide to keep the money it changes their lives and relationships between each other irrevocably. Produced by the creators of “Trainspotting” this black comedy won best acting awards for the three lead performers at the British International Film Festival.

results.title: Shall we dance?
results.creator_credit: Altamira Pictures, Daiei Motion Picture Company, Hakuhodo, Nihon Eiga Shin-sha, Nihon Terebi, Tetsuya Ikeda, Shoji Masui, Yuji Ogata and Masayuki Suo
results.brief_description: Suo’s second feature after his offbeat comic debut “Sumo Do, Sumo Don’t”, this wistful comedy about a Japanese salaryman who discovers the joys of ballroom dancing was hugely successful in its country of origin. Each evening, as he commutes home to his wife and daughter, Shohei Sugiyama, a typically strait-laced Japanese businessmen, catches a glimpse of a beautiful woman gazing out the window of a dance school. Unable to contain his curiosity, he enrols for classes in order to make contact with her. A snooty ex-professional dancer, she keeps her distance from Sugiyama, but through his newfound love of dancing he befriends a group of people who share his secret passion, including an office colleague who becomes a flamboyant mambo king on the dance floor. Touching and uplifting, the film also offers a subtle critique of restrictive cultural norms in a country where ballroom dancing is regarded as a slightly embarrassing, suspicious past-time because of the close physical proximity of the dancers. Cast includes Koji Yakusho, Taoiyo Kusakari, Naoto Takenaka and Eriko Watanabe. In Japanese with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Altamira Pictures, Daiei Motion Picture Company, Hakuhodo, Nihon Eiga Shin-sha, Nihon Terebi, Tetsuya Ikeda, Shoji Masui, Yuji Ogata and Masayuki Suo

results.title: Shaft in Africa
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Shaft Productions, Roger Lewis and John Guillermin
results.brief_description: Super-slick detective John Shaft (Richard Roundtree) is back in this violent and action-packed follow up to “Shaft” (1971) and “Shaft’s Big Score” (1972). This time, Shaft is persuaded by African diplomats at the United Nations to hunt down and expose the operator of a sinister slave-trading racket. After receiving lessons in African customs from the diplomat’s beautiful daughter, Aleme (Vonetta McGee), Shaft goes to Africa and, posing as a native, allows himself to be captured. Things appear to be going smoothly until a traitor in the organisation reveals Shaft’s true identity. Forced to fend off attacks on his life using only traditional fighting methods, Shaft is caught in a race against time to bring the ruthless, murderous traders to justice. ‘Shaft in Africa’ is a bold, fast-paced film featuring memorable dialogue, saucy images, and a funky soundtrack. Richard Roundtree won an MTV Movie Award for lifetime achievement in 1994 for his roles in the Shaft films.
